intro: Senecio mohinorensis, commonly known as the Mohinorensis Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
